etymologies: mid 18th century: from French clarinette, diminutive of clarine, denoting a kind of bell; related to clarion

definitions: a woodwind instrument with a single-reed mouthpiece, a cylindrical tube with a flared end, and holes stopped by keys.
shortDefinitions: woodwind instrument with single-reed mouthpiece, cylindrical tube with flared end

definitions: an organ stop with a tone resembling that of a clarinet.
shortDefinitions: organ stop with tone resembling that of clarinet
